patterns: What criticisms were raised against hosting the World Cup in Qatar?
responses: The choice to host the World Cup in Qatar attracted significant criticism due to concerns over the country's treatment of migrant workers, women, and members of the LGBT community, as well as issues related to Qatar's climate, lack of a strong football culture, scheduling changes, and allegations of bribery and corruption.

patterns: Who were the defending champions in the 2022 FIFA World Cup?

patterns: what were the new substitution rules in the tournament?what was the new rule regarding concussion substitutions in the tournament?
responses: In the tournament, teams could make up to five substitutions in normal time, and an additional substitution in extra time. The tournament was the first World Cup to feature concussion substitutions, allowing each team to use a maximum of one concussion substitute during a match, which did not count towards the team's quota of regular substitutions.

patterns: who was the first player to be replaced by a dedicated concussion substitute in this world cup?

why was there a change in an event of world cup 2022?
which month was world Cup event was organised?
responses: The 2022 FIFA World Cup was not held in June and July, as is typical, due to Qatar's intense summer heat and high humidity. Instead, it was played in November and December.

patterns: How did the 2022 World Cup schedule affect domestic football leagues?
responses: The 2022 World Cup being held in November and December required many domestic football leagues, including major European leagues, to incorporate extended breaks in their schedules to accommodate the World Cup.

patterns: How did major European football competitions adjust their schedules for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Major European football competitions scheduled their group matches to be played before the World Cup to avoid playing these matches in the following year.

patterns: When was the match schedule for the 2022 World Cup confirmed by FIFA?

patterns: What were the new substitution rules in the tournament?

patterns: What was the new rule regarding concussion substitutions in the tournament?
responses: The tournament was the first World Cup to feature concussion substitutions, allowing each team to use a maximum of one concussion substitute during a match, which did not count towards the team's quota of regular substitutions.

patterns: Who was the first player to be replaced by a dedicated concussion substitute in this World Cup?
responses: Iranian goalkeeper Alireza Beiranvand was the first player to be replaced by a dedicated concussion substitute in this World Cup, after suffering a concussion in the opening match against England.

patterns: When did the bidding procedure for the 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cups begin?
responses: The bidding procedure to host the 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cups began in January 2009.

patterns: What was the deadline for national associations to register interest in hosting the World Cups?
responses: National associations had until 2 February 2009 to register their interest in hosting the 2018 and 2022 FIFA World Cups.

patterns: How many initial bids were there for the 2018 FIFA World Cup?
responses: Initially, there were 11 bids for the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

patterns: Which countries withdrew or had their bids rejected for the 2018 FIFA World Cup?
responses: Mexico withdrew its bid for the 2018 FIFA World Cup, and Indonesia's bid was rejected by FIFA.

patterns: Why were UEFA members no longer in contention to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup?
responses: After UEFA was guaranteed to host the 2018 event, members of UEFA were no longer in contention to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

patterns: Australia, Japan, Qatar, South Korea, and the USA

Australia, Japan, Qatar, South Korea, and the United States
responses: The countries remaining in contention to host the 2022 FIFA World Cup were Australia, Japan, Qatar, South Korea, and the United States.

patterns: When did the FIFA Executive Committee vote to select the hosts?
When did the FIFA Executive Committee vote to select the hosts of the 2018 and 2022 World Cups?
responses: The 22-member FIFA Executive Committee convened on 2 December 2010 to vote to select the hosts of both tournaments.

patterns: two FIFA executive committee members suspended
Why were two FIFA executive committee members suspended before the vote?
responses: Two FIFA executive committee members were suspended before the vote in relation to allegations of corruption regarding their votes.

patterns: Why was the decision to host the 2022 World Cup in Qatar criticized?
responses: The decision to host the 2022 World Cup in Qatar was criticized due to it being graded as having high operational risk and being part of the FIFA corruption scandals.

patterns: What were the voting patterns for the 2022 FIFA World Cup bidding?
responses: In the 2022 FIFA World Cup bidding, Qatar received 11 votes in the first round, 10 in the second, 11 in the third, and 14 in the fourth, winning the bid. The United States, South Korea, Japan, and Australia received various numbers of votes across the rounds, with Qatar ultimately being selected.

patterns: What was the estimated cost of hosting the World Cup?
Who disputed the estimated cost of the World Cup and what was their claim?
responses: Qatari officials, including the organizing CEO Nasser Al Khater, disputed the estimated cost of over $220 billion, stating that the true cost was around $8 billion.

patterns: Who disputed the estimated cost of the World Cup and what was their claim?
responses: Qatari officials, including the organizing CEO Nasser Al Khater, disputed the estimated cost of over $220 billion, stating that the true cost was around $8 billion.

patterns: How many new stadiums were built specifically for the 2022 FIFA World Cup?
How many new stadiums were built
responses: Six of the eight venues, including the Lusail Stadium which hosted the final, were new stadiums built specifically for the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

patterns: When were the first five proposed venues for the World Cup unveiled?
responses: The first five proposed venues for the World Cup were unveiled at the beginning of March 2010.

patterns: What criteria were the World Cup stadiums intended to meet?
responses: The World Cup stadiums in Qatar were intended to reflect the country's history and culture, with designs meeting criteria of legacy, comfort, accessibility, and sustainability.

patterns: What feature did the stadiums have to combat heat?
responses: The stadiums were equipped with cooling systems aimed at reducing temperatures within the stadium by up to 20 °C (36 °F).

patterns: How did Qatar market the sustainability of the stadiums?
responses: The stadiums were marketed as zero waste, with plans for the upper tiers to be disassembled after the World Cup and donated to countries with less developed sports infrastructure.

patterns: Who designed the five initial stadium projects?
responses: All of the five initial stadium projects were designed by the German architectural firm Albert Speer & Partners.

patterns: Which were the indoor stadiums used in the World Cup?
responses: The Al Bayt and Al Wakrah stadiums were the only indoor stadiums among the eight used for the World Cup.

patterns: What did Qatar request regarding the number of stadiums in 2013?
responses: In 2013, Qatar requested FIFA approve a smaller number of stadiums due to growing costs, proposing to cut the number to eight or nine from the twelve originally planned.

patterns: How many stadiums were ultimately used for the World Cup?
responses: Eight stadiums were ultimately used for the World Cup, all located in or near Doha with the exception of Al Khor.

Stadium 974, formerly known as the Ras Abu Aboud Stadium, was the first temporary stadium ever used for a FIFA World Cup, constructed using shipping containers and intended to be completely dismantled after the tournament.

patterns: Which stadium had its capacity reduced after the tournament?
responses: The Al Bayt Stadium had its upper tier of seating removed to reduce capacity after the tournament.

patterns: What were the locations of stadiums?
What were the capacities of stadiums?
What were the locations and capacities of the 2022 FIFA World Cup stadiums?
responses: The 2022 FIFA World Cup stadiums and their capacities were: Al Bayt Stadium in Al Khor (68,895), Lusail Stadium in Lusail (88,966), Ahmad bin Ali Stadium in Al Rayyan (45,032), Education City Stadium (44,667), Khalifa International Stadium (45,857), Al Thumama Stadium in Doha (44,400), Stadium 974 (44,089), and Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah (44,325).

patterns: What were the base camps used for in the World Cup?
responses: Base camps were used by the 32 national squads to stay and train before and during the World Cup tournament.

patterns: When did FIFA announce the hotels and training sites for each participating team?
responses: FIFA announced the hotels and training sites for each participating team in July 2022.

patterns: How was this World Cup more compact compared to previous editions?
responses: This World Cup was the most compact since the inaugural edition in 1930, with 24 of the 32 teams being within a 10 km radius of each other, primarily concentrated within the Doha area.

patterns: What was unique about this World Cup in terms of team travel?
responses: It was the first Cup since 1930 where players did not need to take flights to matches and could remain at the same training base throughout the entire tournament.

patterns: What were Argentina's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Argentina's team stayed at Qatar University Hostel 1 and trained at Qatar University Training Site 3.

patterns: What were Australia's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Australia's team stayed at New Aspire Academy Athlete Accommodation and trained at Aspire Zone Training Facilities 5.

patterns: What were Belgium's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Belgium's team stayed at Hilton Salwa Beach Resort and Villas and trained at Salwa Training Site.

patterns: How much did each team in the round of 16 (9th–16th place) of the 2022 World Cup receive?
responses: Each team in the round of 16 (9th–16th place) of the 2022 World Cup received $13 million.

patterns: What were Brazil's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Brazil's team stayed at The Westin Doha Hotel and Spa and trained at Al Arabi SC Stadium.

patterns: What were Cameroon's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Cameroon's team stayed at Banyan Tree Doha at La Cigale Mushaireb and trained at Al Sailiya SC Stadium.

patterns: What were Canada's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Canada's team stayed at Century Marina Hotel Lusail and trained at Umm Salal SC Training Facilities.

patterns: What were Costa Rica's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Costa Rica's team stayed at dusitD2 Salwa Doha and trained at Al Ahli SC Stadium.

patterns: What were Croatia's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Croatia's team stayed at Hilton Doha and trained at Al Ersal Training Site 3.

patterns: What were Denmark's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Denmark's team stayed at Retaj Salwa Resort & SPA and trained at Al Sailiya SC 2.

patterns: What were Ecuador's hotel and training site for the World Cup?
responses: Ecuador's team stayed at Hyatt Regency Oryx Doha and trained at Mesaimeer SC Training Facilities.

patterns: How did continental confederations organize qualification
How did FIFA's continental confederations organize qualification
How did FIFA's continental confederations organize qualification for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: FIFA's six continental confederations organized their own qualifying competitions and all 211 FIFA member associations were eligible to enter qualification.

patterns: How did Qatar qualify for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Qatar, as the host nation, automatically qualified for the tournament but also participated in the Asian qualifying stage, which doubled as qualification for the 2023 AFC Asian Cup.

patterns: How did Qatar's participation in the Asian qualifiers affect other teams?
responses: Since Qatar reached the final stage as winners in their group, Lebanon, the fifth-best second-place team, advanced instead.

patterns: How did France qualify for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: France, the reigning World Cup champions, qualified for the event through European qualification.

patterns: Which teams withdrew from their continental qualifications due to COVID-19?
Which teams withdrew from their continental qualifications
responses: North Korea withdrew from the AFC qualifying round, while both American Samoa and Samoa withdrew from the OFC qualification, and Vanuatu and Cook Islands also withdrew due to COVID-19 outbreaks and travel restrictions.

patterns: Why did Tonga withdraw from World Cup qualification?
responses: Tonga withdrew from World Cup qualification after the 2022 Hunga Tonga–Hunga Ha'apai eruption and tsunami.

intents.tag: Teams Returning to the World Cup
patterns: Which teams returned to the 2022 World Cup after missing the 2018 tournament?
responses: The Netherlands, Ecuador, Ghana, Cameroon, and the United States returned to the 2022 World Cup after missing the 2018 tournament.

patterns: When was Canada's last World Cup appearance before 2022?
responses: Canada returned to the World Cup after 36 years, their last appearance being in 1986.

patterns: What was notable about Wales' participation in the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Wales made their first World Cup appearance in 64 years, the longest-ever gap for any team, with their only previous participation having been in 1958.

patterns: What was significant about Italy's failure to qualify for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Italy, four-time winners, failed to qualify for a second successive World Cup for the first time in their history, losing in the qualification play-off semi-finals.

patterns: Why was Russia disqualified from the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Russia was disqualified from competing in the 2022 World Cup due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

patterns: What was notable about Chile and Nigeria not qualifying?
What was notable about Chile and Nigeria not qualifying for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Chile, the 2015 and 2016 Copa America winners, failed to qualify for the second consecutive time, and Nigeria was defeated by Ghana in the CAF final playoff round, having qualified for the previous three World Cups.

patterns: Which was the lowest ranked team to qualify for the 2022 World Cup?
responses: Ghana was the lowest ranked team to qualify for the 2022 World Cup, ranked 61st.

patterns: Which teams qualified for the 2022 World Cup, listed by region?
responses: The qualified teams were: from AFC - Australia, Iran, Japan, Qatar (hosts), Saudi Arabia, South Korea; from CAF - Cameroon, Ghana, Morocco, Senegal, Tunisia; from CONCACAF - Canada, Costa Rica, Mexico, United States; from CONMEBOL - Argentina, Brazil, Ecuador, Uruguay; and from UEFA - Belgium, Croatia, Denmark, England, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Serbia, Spain, Switzerland, Wales. No teams from OFC qualified.

patterns: What was the maximum size of the provisional squad teams could name before the World Cup?
responses: Before the World Cup, teams named a provisional squad of up to 55 players.

patterns: By when were teams required to name their final squads?
responses: Teams were required to name their final squads by 13 November.

patterns: What was the increase in final squad size for the 2022 World Cup compared to 2018?
responses: In August 2022, FIFA increased the final squad size to 26 players, up from 23 players at the 2018 edition.

patterns: Which teams chose fewer than 26 players for their final squads?
responses: All teams had a total of 26 players in their final squads except for France and Iran, who chose 25 players.

patterns: Where was the final draw for the 2022 World Cup held?
responses: The final draw was held at the Doha Exhibition and Convention Center in Doha on 1 April 2022

patterns: On what basis were teams allocated into pots for the draw?

patterns: Which teams were in Pot 1 for the draw?

In the penalty shootout, Argentina won 4-2 against France
What was the result and who scored in the Argentina vs France final match, including penalties?
responses: The final match between Argentina and France ended 3-3 after extra time. Goals for Argentina were scored by Messi at 23' (penalty) and 108', and Di María at 36'. For France, Mbappé scored at 80' (penalty), 81', and 118' (penalty). In the penalty shootout, Argentina won 4-2 with Messi, Dybala, Paredes, and Montiel scoring for Argentina, and Mbappé and Kolo Muani scoring for France. Coman and Tchouaméni missed their penalties for France.
